uniol.apt.util

Class SpanningTree<G extends IGraph<G,E,N>,E extends IEdge<G,E,N>,N extends INode<G,E,N>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.util.SpanningTree<G,E,N>
  • Type Parameters:
    G - The type of the graph itself.
    E - The type of the edges.
    N - The type of the nodes.

    public class SpanningTree<G extends IGraph<G,E,N>,E extends IEdge<G,E,N>,N extends INode<G,E,N>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculate a spanning tree of a graph based on a breadth-first search.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpanningTree

        private SpanningTree(G graph,
                     N startNode,
                     boolean forwardDirection)
        Construct a new spanning tree
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph for which a spanning tree should be constructed.
        startNode - The start node for the spanning tree.
        forwardDirection - If true, arcs are followed in forward direction, else backward direction.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static <G extends IGraph<G,E,N>,E extends IEdge<G,E,N>,N extends INode<G,E,N>> SpanningTree<G,E,N> get(G graph)
        Construct a spanning tree for the given graph. If a spanning tree was already computed, it is re-used instead of creating a new one.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph itself.
        E - The type of the edges.
        N - The type of the nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph for which a spanning tree should be constructed.
        Returns:
        A spanning tree.

      • getReversed

        public static <G extends IGraph<G,E,N>,E extends IEdge<G,E,N>,N extends INode<G,E,N>> SpanningTree<G,E,N> getReversed(G graph)
        Construct a spanning tree for the given graph with arcs reversed. If a spanning tree was already computed, it is re-used instead of creating a new one. This spanning tree will follow arcs backwards.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph itself.
        E - The type of the edges.
        N - The type of the nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph for which a spanning tree should be constructed.
        Returns:
        A spanning tree.

      • getReversed

        public static <G extends IGraph<G,E,N>,E extends IEdge<G,E,N>,N extends INode<G,E,N>> SpanningTree<G,E,N> getReversed(G graph,
                                                                                                                      N startNode)
        Construct a spanning tree for the given graph with arcs reversed. If a spanning tree was already computed, it is re-used instead of creating a new one. This spanning tree will follow arcs backwards.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph itself.
        E - The type of the edges.
        N - The type of the nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph for which a spanning tree should be constructed.
        startNode - The start node for the spanning tree.
        Returns:
        A spanning tree.

      • get

        private static <G extends IGraph<G,E,N>,E extends IEdge<G,E,N>,N extends INode<G,E,N>> SpanningTree<G,E,N> get(G graph,
                                                                                                               N startNode,
                                                                                                               boolean forwardDirection)
        Construct a spanning tree for the given graph. If a spanning tree was already computed, it is re-used instead of creating a new one.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph itself.
        E - The type of the edges.
        N - The type of the nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph for which a spanning tree should be constructed.
        startNode - The start node for the spanning tree.
        forwardDirection - If true, arcs are followed in forward direction, else backward direction.
        Returns:
        A spanning tree.

      • isReachable

        public boolean isReachable(N node)
        Check if the given node is reachable.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to check.
        Returns:
        True if the node is reachable in this spanning tree, false otherwise.

      • isTotallyReachable

        public boolean isTotallyReachable()
        Check if the underlying graph is totally reachable.
        Returns:
        True if there exists a path to any node, all starting in the specified initial node.

      • getUnreachableNodes

        public java.util.Set<N> getUnreachableNodes()
        Get all the nodes in the graph which are not reachable from the start node.
        Returns:
        Set of unreachable nodes.

      • getPredecessor

        public N getPredecessor(N node)
        Get the predecessor in the tree.
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose predecessor should be returned.
        Returns:
        The predecessor if one exists or null. The start node and unreachable nodes do not have predecessors.

      • getPredecessorEdge

        public E getPredecessorEdge(N node)
        Get the edge via which the given node is reached in the tree.
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose predecessor edge should be returned.
        Returns:
        The predecessor edge if one exists or null. The start node and unreachable nodes do not have predecessors.

      • getEdgePathFromStart

        public java.util.List<E> getEdgePathFromStart(N node)
        Get the path from the start node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose path to return.
        Returns:
        The path from the start node to this node. The first entry will be the outgoing edge from the start node, the last one will be the edge leading to the given node.

      • getNodePathFromStart

        public java.util.List<N> getNodePathFromStart(N node)
        Get the path from the start node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose path to return.
        Returns:
        The path from the start node to this node. The first entry will be the start node, the last one will be the given node.

      • getChords

        public java.util.Set<E> getChords()
        Get the chords of the spanning tree. A chord is an edge which forms a cycle with respect to the tree. In other words, a chord is an edge which is not part of the tree.
        Returns:
        A set of chords for the spanning tree.

      • getStartNode

        public N getStartNode()
        Returns:
        The start node from which the tree was constructed.

      • getGraph

        public G getGraph()
        Returns:
        The graph from which the tree was constructed.
